alert.note: Alert for Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:26PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, EASTERN DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND WEST CENTRAL CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM MDT... At 126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Taiban to 15 miles south of Fort Sumner. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Sumner, House, Tolar and Taiban. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 325 and 358. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Curry County; De Baca County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
